properties.name: Input - Copy All Ports boolean
properties.description:
When True is selected, the workflow will copy all numeric port IDs that are <= port ID from the Source Switch to the Target Switch, ignoring the provided Source and Target Port IDs.
When False is selected the workflow will copy the provided Source Port ID from the Source Switch to the provided Target Port ID on the Target Switch.

Custom workflow created by enovak that copies the switch port configuration from one Meraki switch to another.
If Copy All Ports is set to True, the workflow will copy the configuration from Source Switch Ports to Target Switch Ports for all Port IDs <= the Source Switch Port ID count.  The Source Switch MUST have <= the ports on the Target Switch.  If the Source Switch port count is > than the Target Switch port count, the workflow will stop and report an error.
If Copy All Ports is set to False, the workflow will copy the configuration of the provided Source Port ID to the provided Target Port ID.  The Port IDs MUST not be 0 and must be valid numeric Port IDs on the selected devices.
NOTE: This workflow does not work for Port IDs that are not numeric., i.e. "1_MA-MOD-2X40G_1" or "1_MA-MOD-8X10G_8"
If Convert Allowed VLANs from all to 1-1000 is set to True, any port that is configured as a trunk with Allowed VLANs set to all will copy as Allowed VLANs set to 1-1000
Check if the All Poprts option was selected
Check that the Source switch has less than or equal number of ports as the Target swtich

properties.description: Check that the Source and Target Port IDs are numeric.  Some uplink port IDs are Alphnumeric and that will cause the Update Switch Port Configuration API call to fail when attempting to use a numeric Port ID to update a port with a  Alphanumeric Port ID.
Check that both the Source Port ID and the Target Port ID are equal to the Numeric Loop Port ID
A custom Python Script activity to convert strings into JSON Arrays
properties.script:
import json
import ast

def convert_to_json_array(input_string):
    """
    Converts a string representation of a list into a proper JSON array.
    Handles:
        - empty strings => []
        - stringified lists => ["item1", "item2"]
        - single string values => ["value"]
    """
    if not input_string or not input_string.strip():
        return json.dumps([], indent=4)

    # Clean and prepare the string
    input_string = input_string.strip()

    # Strip outer quotes if it's wrapped
    if (input_string.startswith('"') and input_string.endswith('"')) or \
       (input_string.startswith("'") and input_string.endswith("'")):
        input_string = input_string[1:-1]

    try:
        # Attempt to evaluate as a Python literal (e.g. list)
        parsed = ast.literal_eval(input_string)
        if isinstance(parsed, list):
            return json.dumps(parsed, indent=4)
    except Exception:
        pass

    # Fallback: treat it as a single string item
    return json.dumps([input_string], indent=4)

# Convert strings to JSON arrays
MAC_allow_list = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02O0GNSC901HD7Yk77vlUXLkOlpIqWftmH2.input.source_array[@].macAllowList$')
Tags_list = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02O0GNSC901HD7Yk77vlUXLkOlpIqWftmH2.input.source_array[@].tags$')
Sticky_MAC_allow_list = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02O0GNSC901HD7Yk77vlUXLkOlpIqWftmH2.input.source_array[@].stickyMacAllowList$')

**Cisco Meraki - Devices - Get Device**

Return detailed information about a specific Meraki device within the network.

**Target:** A Meraki Endpoint using HTTPS "api.meraki.com" port 443 and no path.

**Account Key:** Meraki User API Key. API Key can be generated from Merkai Dashboard -> User Profile -> API Access.

Steps:
[] Sends Get Device request to Meraki
[] Check if the request was successful:
[]> If it was, attempt to extract the results and set the output variables
[]> If it wasn't, return the error and marks the workflow as failed.

NOTE: Empty attributes in the request are removed from the payload before sending to Meraki. 

https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-v1/get-device/

properties.description: A custom Python Script activity to convert strings into JSON Arrays
properties.script:
import json
import ast

def convert_to_json_array(input_string):
    """
    Converts a string representation of a list into a proper JSON array.
    Handles:
        - empty strings => []
        - stringified lists => ["item1", "item2"]
        - single string values => ["value"]
    """
    if not input_string or not input_string.strip():
        return json.dumps([], indent=4)

    # Clean and prepare the string
    input_string = input_string.strip()

    # Strip outer quotes if it's wrapped
    if (input_string.startswith('"') and input_string.endswith('"')) or \
       (input_string.startswith("'") and input_string.endswith("'")):
        input_string = input_string[1:-1]

    try:
        # Attempt to evaluate as a Python literal (e.g. list)
        parsed = ast.literal_eval(input_string)
        if isinstance(parsed, list):
            return json.dumps(parsed, indent=4)
    except Exception:
        pass

    # Fallback: treat it as a single string item
    return json.dumps([input_string], indent=4)

# Convert strings to JSON arrays
MAC_allow_list = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02O0GNT8V3X1B2iAcytYa3qgRvfR2bS10aQ.output.output_table[0].macAllowList$')
Tags_list = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02O0GNT8V3X1B2iAcytYa3qgRvfR2bS10aQ.output.output_table[0].tags$')
Sticky_MAC_allow_list = convert_to_json_array('$activity.definition_activity_02O0GNT8V3X1B2iAcytYa3qgRvfR2bS10aQ.output.output_table[0].stickyMacAllowList$')
